title: Data Engineer consultant - Risk and Regulatory Reporting
description:
Our aim is to support our clients incorporating changes and innovations in valuation, risk and compliance. We share the ambition to contribute to a sustainable and resilient financial system and facing these extraordinary challenges is what drives us every day. Our people are empowered to design and implement efficient and pragmatic solutions. Acting as one team with our partners and clients, we bring a distinctive mix of financial and technological know-how. This unique blend of expertise, team spirit and fairness has contributed to more than 35 years of successful projects and trustful relationships.
  

  

At Finalyse, we believe that each member is unique and that diversity enriches us in many ways. We strive for an inclusive working environment that pursues mutual respect for each other's beliefs and backgrounds.
  

  

**THE ROLE**
  

  

In an increasingly complex regulatory environment and financial world, shaping state-of-the-art reporting capability and data intelligence is essential to bank's core business and financial stability. Finalyse embraces this evolution and is committed to maintain a cutting-edge approach in its Data Management Advisory services.
  

  

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer/Risk Data Analyst to join our team.
  

  

You will be working on vital and massive finance and risk datasets, designing and building automated, reliable data aggregation solutions to fulfill management and regulatory reporting needs in the banking industry. In this role, you will have a direct impact on bank's internal and external stakeholders.
  

  

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of risk calculation and reporting and will be able to build data infrastructure that not only meets architectural and data quality standards but, most of all, business requirements that are meaningful for risk managers.
  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**
  

  

You participate to/or lead engagements of our Risk Advisory practice for banking and insurance clients to help them build and maintain their data infrastructure for risk and regulatory reporting. As a Data Engineer, you:
* will work closely with clients to understand business requirements and help them implement risk data and reporting solutions that are fit-for-purpose, ensuring a straight-through-processing and compliance with regulatory standards, including BCBS 239,
* can deep dive into details and investigate reconciliation issues with other reporting systems, such as accounting systems or other source systems,
* will advise our clients on how to implement governance policies and procedures,
* can develop and maintain documentation for all data-related processes, including data lineage, data dictionary, and metadata,
* will stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in the field of data infrastructure and data governance and implement them where applicable.

**MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS**
* You have an MA or MSc in management sciences, applied economics or computer sciences.
* At least 5 years of experience in data engineering within financial institutions or a related field, with a strong understanding of banking business and financial products.
* You have outstanding analytical skills.
* You are proficient in SQL, SAS or Python or other programming languages.
* You are familiar with BCBS 239 and its requirements for data governance, data quality, and risk management.
* You are able to act as a bridge between business and IT stakeholders.
* You are able to work autonomously in a result-oriented environment.
* You are fluent in English (both verbal and written) and have strong presentation skills.

**NICE TO HAVE**
* Knowledge of data modeling methodologies and techniques for data warehouses and data marts.
* Proficiency in data modeling and management tools such as PowerDesigner, Visio and Collibra.
* Understanding of risk calculation (especially credit risk) and reporting processes.
* Knowledge of European risk regulation (CRR2, CRR3, Basel IV).
* First-hand experience with Agile ways of working is a plus.

**OUR OFFER**
* The opportunity to join a diverse, multinational, dynamic team of talented and passionate individuals with a broad range of analytical and technical skills.
* An excellent working environment with a space for defining your own specialization and career within our flat and flexible structure.
* The opportunity to take initiatives and responsibilities quickly in a fast growing company.
* Extensive training programs adapted to your personal needs, both on technical matters as well as on softs skills.
* Coaching and mentoring by more experienced colleagues.
* Flexible working arrangements - remote/hybrid work mode and 9/10 or 4/5 possible time schedules.
* Attractive remuneration package and extra-legal benefits (health insurance, pension benefits, mobility package, etc.)
* Travel opportunities inside European countries.

title: Product Analyst
description:
**What is the role about?**



We are expanding our data & analytics department at Bitvavo and therefore we are on the lookout for a Product Analyst to join our team. This role contributes to Bitvavo’s analytics culture through data products and services, and is specifically focussed on helping the Retail trading domain build a better consumer trading experience. In the Analytics team you are dedicated to forge the future of crypto trading while creating analytical insights, building data products, enhancing data quality and standards for better decisions, and empowering all parties with information to accelerate their activities.


**How will you make an impact?**



In this role you'll work together with other Analysts, Scientists and Engineers in facilitating Product teams with insights from data. The role involves transforming and curating datasets, generating actionable insights, and enabling your stakeholders. You will be a proactive advisor to the business, while developing insightful solutions. There is a lot of freedom to bring your expertise and ideas into practice. You will be responsible, amongst others, for the following:


* Analyse data and derive actionable insights to solve business challenges and discover opportunities
* Help Product Managers design, set, perform, and analyse experiments
* Partner with business stakeholders to drive the data culture at Bitvavo
* Own data analysis projects from end-to-end and convert results to drive action
* Collaborate with the data engineering team to enhance the data sets and pipelines
* Enable the business through self-service solutions


**How will you be successful?**


* 2+ years of experience in a similar role
* Preferably an academic degree in a STEM related area: e.g. Mathematics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Business Analytics or similar
* Experience in performing data analysis and predictive modelling using scripting languages (SQL), BI tools (like Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI) and Python/R
* End-to-end understanding of database, data warehouse development, and data transformation tools
* Eagerness to work in a fast-paced industry and company that grows in a rapid tempo
* Ability to communicate technical results to non-technical stakeholders
* Interest in the consumer trading and crypto space


*Bitvavo does not accept resumes from staffing, search, or recruitment firms without a signed agreement. If you send us a resume without such an agreement, we may contact the candidate directly without any obligation whatsoever and no fee of any kind will be paid should we hire the candidate.*
  
**Benefits**
------------


We care about our people. That's why we have a broad range of benefits to support them mentally, physically, and in their career growth. And an extra holiday for your birthday, just for fun.**Flexible well-being budget****Training and development budget****Competitive package****Hybrid working****Pension scheme****26 days holiday leave****Internet allowance****Mental health support platform**

title: Data Engineer - Azure Databricks
description:
Data Engineer - Azure Databricks**At a glance**
---------------


Are you passionate about working with financial data, do you have hands-on experience with data engineering techniques, and do you want to help us build a finance domain data store? Then we believe we have a great opportunity for you.


We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team. At the moment 18 professionals are working together from different expertise areas to create high quality data marts and reports.

**Your job**
------------


We are looking for a data engineer with passion, overview and technical skills. As a member of a DevOps team you are responsible for development but also daily operations. In a short period of time you are able to obtain extensive knowledge of our large and complex data models to be able to make the necessary future changes, support production or to support new requirements.


Additionally, you can help existing data engineers with challenges in Databricks by using PySpark and SQL and implement business requirements.


Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organises work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be working as a Data Engineer within the finance domain in a dynamic and energetic team of professionals who all are critical thinkers and share the same passion. We are ambitious and learning every day. We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment with many opportunities for innovation. We provide personal development opportunities and encourage co-working with stakeholders to come up with the best solutions for their needs.

**Your profile**
----------------


You are up to date with the latest developments in data engineering and Databricks. The job requires excellent analytical skills and an eye for detail.

* You have an affinity with financial reporting
* Strong analytic skills, data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling
* Expertise in Azure Databricks, Python, PySpark and SQL (must)
* Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets (must)
* Experience in data modelling and Kimball methodology (must)
* Experience in stakeholder management
* Experience with Azure DevOps, Boards, Git repositories, Pipelines
* Experience with data management, data governance, DQ, and meta data
* Pro-active attitude and an excellent team player.
* You are at least AZ-900 certified or willing to pass within 3 month.
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills.
* A good work-life balance
* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* A hybrid way of working
* A salary ranging from 4345.- to 6207.- per month based on a 36-hour workweek and a seniority level
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
* An annual public transportation pass
* A solid pension plan
**Interested?**
---------------


If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact marc.veldt@nl.abnamro.com (Chapter Lead)

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

### **Wij vragen**

* Samenwerkingsgerichtheid
* Passie voor je vakgebied
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Scientific Software Engineer
description:
Careers > Scientific Software Engineer
  
  

At Solynta we are unlocking the True Potential of Potatoes through our hybrid potato breeding technology. We aim to drive sustainable improvements in world food security and farmer’s livelihoods with new hybrid potato varieties, grown from our true potato seeds.
  
  

The technologies applied to achieve this use large amounts of data and innovative models for decision making. As Solynta is further expanding its activities, we're committed to enhancing the quality and scalability of our software.To expand our Data DevOps Team and to help drive our business we are looking for a:
  
  

Scientific Software Engineer (fulltime)
  
  

The primary focus of this position is to elevate our prototype software and pipelines into robust production systems, ensuring high quality and maintainability. The scientific software engineer is responsible for spearheading, developing, and maintaining our in-house production software and data analysis pipelines.
  
  

Key activities / responsibilities
  
  

As an experienced software engineer, you will work with scientists to turn the latest research insights into production-ready code. Writing reliable code that excels in speed and maintainability is your strength. Naturally proactive, you improve the technology stack with new software packages and promote good software development practices. Embracing a DevOps way of working, you are both result-driven and empathetic, always seeking to grow as a team. You enjoy working on the AWS cloud environment or are at least keen to get familiar with AWS cloud services.
  
  

Typical project
  
  

The agronomy research team discovers a new methodology to monitor potato plants using drones at our sites. Together with the scientist you develop processing code, and a Streamlit dashboard to visualize the results. With the data engineer you setup datasets in the data lake, and schedule daily processing pipelines. With the DevOps engineer, you deploy your code and dashboard to AWS ECS. Due to your work, field trials are more effective, and additional stress resistant potato varieties are available much quicker.
  
  

Requirements
  
  

**Experience:**  

Software engineer education or by training
  
5+ years of software development experience
  
Python, R, Bash
  
R Shiny, Streamlit, DJANGO, Pandas
  
Proficient at Linux and Docker usage
  
Gitlab CI/CD
  
Familiar with AWS EC2, AWS S3
  
  

**You are someone who:**  

Is a good communicator, as you will work with different stakeholders
  
Can organize your own work and manage expectations
  
Enjoys working in a flat organization with minimal hierarchy
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

An enthusiastic and growing team with ambition and passion to drive real change
  
The opportunity to join a dedicated team working on ground-breaking innovations for improving the global food supply
  
Home office is situated in Wageningen
  
Opportunities for growth and development within a dynamic organization
  
A high degree of independence and responsibility within your role
  
  

**Application:**  

To join our team as a Scientific Software Engineer please submit the form below or send an e-mail to recruitment@solynta.com including:
  
  

A short motivation why this position and working at Solynta both align with your personal goals and ambitions
  
Your CV For inquiries about the application process and the vacancy, please email recruitment@solynta.com.
  
  

Take the next step in your career and drive innovation at Solynta - apply today!

title: Data Engineer
description:
Careers > Data Engineer
  
  

At Solynta we are unlocking the True Potential of Potatoes through our hybrid potato breeding technology. We aim to drive sustainable improvements in world food security and farmer’s livelihoods with new hybrid potato varieties, grown from our true potato seeds.
  
  

The technologies applied to achieve this use large amounts of data and innovative models for decision-making. As Solynta is further expanding its activities, the quality and scalability of the software must also improve. To expand our Data DevOps Team and to help drive our business, we are looking for a:
  
  

Data Engineer (fulltime)
  
  

The primary focus of this position is to connect new data sources, develop the data lake, and setup processing pipelines. Solynta is rapidly taking up new methods to monitor potato plants, and to analyze large amounts of potatoes coming from trial fields. The data needs to be stored in a way that allows efficient and scalable access from processing pipelines. Apart from technical work, scientists’ software developers need coaching and mentoring on implementing scalable processing techniques.
  
  

Key activities / responsibilities
  
  

As an experienced data engineer, you will work with scientists and software developers to setup the new data sets and let their code and dashboards utilize the data. You will tackle performance bottlenecks, so that processing runs fast and cost efficient. You pro-actively keep up to date with the latest Python/R packages for data engineering, as well as developments on AWS cloud. Embracing a DevOps way of working, you are both result-driven and empathetic, always seeking to grow as a team. You enjoy working on the AWS cloud or are at least keen to get familiar with AWS cloud services.
  
  

Typical project
  
  

The agronomy research team discovers a new methodology to monitor potato plants using drones at our sites. Together with the scientist you setup the data sets with S3 and Glue and prepare pipelines with Polars to fill the data sets. Together with the DevOps engineer, you setup tasks on ECS to process the data within minutes after arrival, so that the Streamlit dashboard can present the latest insights.

title: Data Analyst
description:
As Data Analyst at Effectory you will be improving the working lives of millions of people by leveraging employee data to help companies make better decisions, optimize operations, gain insights, and achieve strategic objectives. In this role you can apply your knowledge of analyzing and interpreting HR- and employee-data in a variety of ways.

  

This role divides its time between the Product Development and Consulting with separate but overlapping responsibilities. Formally you will be part of the Data Team, that is part of Product Development.  



  

The role of Data Analyst has 3 areas of responsibility:


**Product Development (50%)**

  


Collaborating with our data scientist, you will develop data-driven enhancements for our products and services, leveraging our data in innovative ways. Your contributions can include constructing predictive and descriptive models that empower our customers to better understand, interpret, and act on their survey results.


This role involves tasks such as data collection, pre-processing, and conducting various types of exploratory analysis using survey data, metadata, and web analytics. You will have the creative freedom to incorporate additional external data as needed. Making data visible through dashboards and reports is crucial for our product's success, and you will design innovative dashboards based on the data you collect and analyze, providing valuable insights to our customers.

 **Data Analysis for Thought Leadership** (25-40%)


For 2024 and beyond, our team of consultants aims to strengthen our thought leadership capability. Building on our historical data, benchmarks, and numerous studies, we have a wealth of relevant and interesting data to share more (pro-)actively, something our customers expect from us and frequently inquire about.As a Data Analyst you will collaborate closely with our Consultant - Thought Leader to investigate hypotheses and create relevant insights. We share these insights with our marketing and sales teams, use them to present during events as well as for our customer facing teams, helping them in both their commercial and advisory tasks.


**Custom Data Analysis for** **Customers (10-25%)**

  


Although we do not actively offer custom data analyses to customers, around 30 enterprise customers per year request custom analyses based on our research, sometimes in combination with their own data. This sometime involves doing an intake with the customer and possibly also an explanation of the findings.  



  

  

You are an experienced Data Analyst with at least 3 years relevant work experience. You have a master’s degree, with a quantitative character, like for instance econometrics, mathematics, or data science. Next to that:


* You have experience with modern data analysis tooling such as Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks, SQL, Databricks.
* Experience in the different phases of the analysis life cycle: data collection, extraction, cleaning and preparation, statistical methods for analysis, visualization and reporting and data modeling predicting
* Strong analytical skills and a proactive, results-oriented mindset.
* Good communication skills in English.
* If you have experience in the field of HR/Employee data that is a plus


**THIS IS US**

  


Effectory – Europe’s leading feedback specialist – is a thriving company with more than 200 entrepreneurial, young and ambitious professionals who help big and medium sized companies to collect feedback and ideas from their employees. Our mission is to work on making the working world better. Based in the center of Amsterdam, Munich and Cape Town, our multi-disciplinary teams collaborate with more than 1200 customers in ‘industries’ as varied as Retail, Production, Services and Non-Profit in over 110 countries.  



  

Historically we have a strong foothold at the Dutch market which was our place of birth and we can't be stopped! To meet our growth ambition, we are determined to only hire eager and enthusiastic employees - both starters and experienced workers - who help infuse our business with even more energy.  



  

**THIS IS WHAT WE OFFER**

* A monthly salary (*the range for this position is around* *€ 45.000 - € 65.000 gross a year based on full-time employment* *depending on your experienc**e).*
* An annual bonus scheme.
* 25 holidays for FTEs, and flexible public holiday options.
* A fun and interactive onboarding program to get to know our company and some of your new colleagues.
* A learning budget to spend on your own personal development. We also provide extensive professional and personal development opportunities and organize yearly summer and winter schools.
* Flexible working: you will be able to work max 60% of your contract hours from home (or any other location in the Netherlands).
* Budget to set up your home office.
* Yearly Body & Mind budget to spend on anything that energizes (or relaxes) you.
* Annual events, such as our Winter Party, Summer Party & the legendary Big Day.
* Additional monthly compensation for working from home.
* The option to work abroad for up to 4 months, and to take an unpaid sabbatical.
* You get your birthday off work and can also take a day to volunteer for a cause of your choice.

***This is a*** ***part-time position for 32 hours*** ***(4 days) and with a start date as soon as possible.***

  

Please note that we cannot provide visa sponsorship or relocation for this position.

 **THIS IS HOW IT WORKS**


1. *You want this job*: submit your application via the link below


2. *We are intrigued*: join a phone or video call to get to know each other a bit better and to ask questions


3. *We all think it went well*: we now meet live (or in a video call) to get to know each other a bit better


4. *We want to see you in action:* you complete a case/assessment (if applicable)


5. *The final hurdle*: we agree on terms & conditions, we sign and you start!
company_description: At Effectory, we understand the power of both technology and human connection.

title: Python Software Engineer
Marketing Data Analyst
description:
You're passionate about data, aren't you? Here's your chance to leverage your passion for data and innovative strategies and campaigns! Lead our growth and make your mark in the world of fintech. Ready to take your Data skills to new heights?


### **What will you do?**



As a Data Analyst with BridgeFund, you play a crucial role in expanding marketing data and transforming insights into targeted strategies. You will analyze customer data and market trends to measure and improve campaign effectiveness. By conducting customer segmentation and profiling, you create detailed profiles for targeted marketing strategies. You optimize marketing processes by advising on and implementing process automation. You will work in the data team alongside Data Engineers and Data Scientists, who ensure the data foundation and support other teams with their data-related issues. Your work, along with your colleagues', ensures that we operate in an increasingly data-driven manner as an organization.

 **What you will do:**


* Your analyses of marketing data and proposals for optimizations and automations will result in improved campaign conversions.
* You identify and define different customer segments based on behavior, demographics, and other relevant factors to gain better insights into customer behavior.
* You contribute to creating a culture within the marketing team where data-driven decision-making is central.
* Identify and combine customer segments for targeted marketing approaches.
* Create clear reports and visualizations to communicate insights.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to incorporate data-driven insights into business strategies.
* Assist the marketing team in conducting A/B testing.


**What we offer:**  

A fun, challenging position at an ambitious FinTech scale-up in a fast-growing environment. No day is the same. You'll have a lot of freedom and responsibility, allowing you to develop quickly and make a real impact on the organization.

  

* A good salary between €3.900 and €5.000 based on a 40-hour workweek.
* 26 vacation days; plenty of time to recharge.
* Your pension is well arranged with ASR, +4% on your gross salary.
* You receive €0.21 per kilometer for travel expenses, even if you come by bike.
* Uber(Eats), ClassPass, or Felyx credit? Customize your secondary benefits with €40 YourCampus credit per month.
* We consider your development super important. That's why we offer individual training as well as team training.
* A super funky office in Amsterdam, near Amstel station. No cubicles or drop ceilings here.
* Parties and boat trips. Friends coming along? Great!
* We throw the coolest parties and drinks every quarter. We celebrate our successes together.
* Skiing trips or partying in Berlin. You won't want to miss our fully paid trips abroad.
* A catered lunch every day.
* A good fixed workspace. You'll get a MacBook and two monitors from us. We also have standing desks if you prefer.
* A place where you feel at home and everyone can be themselves.


**Our Culture:**



What makes us unique is our culture. This is also one of the main reasons why we are growing so rapidly. We share the same mindset. We are a close-knit team of driven, ambitious people who want to disrupt the financial world. We are true entrepreneurs. You can feel it in our workplace. We work hard, but we also celebrate our successes in a big way together. Hierarchy is a difficult word for us, and we only do top-down when we go skiing together. We ask critical questions, give honest feedback, and are not afraid to fail occasionally, because failure means learning, and learning means growth.

### **What we can learn form you:**



As a Data Analyst at BridgeFund, you bring a wealth of experience and expertise in data analysis. We are looking for someone proficient with tools such as SQL, Python, and data visualization platforms like Qlik, Tableau, or Power BI. Communication skills are essential to translate complex analyses into actionable insights for non-technical colleagues and to collaborate effectively within teams.

 **What we expect from you:**


* Minimum 3-5 years of experience in a successful data analysis role, preferably within a marketing context.
* Experience with data tools such as SQL, Python, and preferably Databricks.
* Knowledge of statistical methods for analyzing marketing data.
* Understand marketing fundamentals for linking analyses and processes.
* Ability to communicate complex analyses in a meaningful way.
* You are a team player, yet independent and resourceful.
* Fluent in English.

  

**About BridgeFund: a FinTech scale-up on a mission**



BridgeFund, founded in 2018 in Amsterdam, is a club of headstrong and sometimes a little impatient go-getters who want to make social impact. A group of 90 ambitious, positive rebels. A group that works hard, but doesn't take itself too seriously. A team of like-minded people, committed to the same mission: to show that a bank-free world is easier, more efficient, fairer and therefore more fun. What we do. Build a digital bridge between idle capital of successful entrepreneurs and working capital for ambitious entrepreneurs. Through smart technology, we analyze a company's financial data at lightning speed and carefully to determine the maximum amount an entrepreneur can borrow responsibly. On the other hand, we have investors who make all this possible! And together, we are moving the Netherlands forward.

  


Dear agencies: if we need external recruiters to help us fill vacancies, it will be through HirePort. Through this form, you can register yourself there as an external recruiter: https://hireport.nl/bridgefund/. That also means you don’t have to call me or a hiring manager! :)

title: Youda - Business Analyst
description:
Join us at Playtika (NASDAQ: PLTK), where we're driven by the belief life needs play. We're on a mission to deliver infinite ways to play using cutting-edge technologies like AI and machine learning to craft immersive experiences that connect, inspire and entertain millions of players worldwide.


From our start as a small mobile games company founded in Israel to our current position as a publicly traded company and industry leader, we continue to be a dominant force in interactive entertainment. With a diverse portfolio of award-winning, category-leading Casual and Social Casino-themed games, including nine of the top 100 highest-grossing mobile games in the US, we're setting the standard for excellence.



Our success story is co-authored by a dynamic team of storytellers, strategists, creators and data scientists who thrive on innovation. We are home of the best, advancing an inclusive culture that embraces our core values and reflects our agile DNA.



With a strong financial foundation, disciplined operations, unwavering player-focused approach and relentless can-do spirit, we're well-positioned for sustained growth. If you're ready to join the driving force behind the evolution of interactive entertainment, we invite you to come play with us.

**ABOUT YOUDA GAMES**



We are growing! Therefore, we are looking for a talented **BUSINESS ANALYST** for our studio in Amsterdam. Better known as **YOUDA GAMES**. From our studio we supply the world with Governor of Poker 3 and Monopoly Poker.



We want users to have a fun time playing our games, it's that simple. Making games our fans can't stop playing is our goal. Our studio is loaded with motivated, talented and creative people that will make any possible effort to fulfill our promise. We are fast-paced, nimble and laugh a lot, at least we try to



We work hard, but also prioritize our fun, collaborative and well-balanced culture.


**ABOUT THE JOB!**



Business Analytics Playtikans have a talent for identifying bottlenecks and areas of growth potential using their ANALYTICAL skills. And want to work at a growing international company with great perks and benefits.


**Job Description & Responsibilities:**



As a Business Analyst you'll embark on an epic quest to wield data as your weapon and conquer the challenges of user engagement, growth, and monetization. You'll join forces with our product managers and game makers to unlock the secrets of gameplay enhancement and user retention, all while enjoying the excitement of the gaming universe!



Last but not least you're able to tell the data as a story and make it accessible through proper visualization for the rest of the studio.


**Requirements:**


* 3+ years of analytical work experience, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the online gaming industry.
* Strong SQL skills with experience in querying large, complex data sets.
* High proficiency in data visualization tools (preferably Tableau)
* A methodological approach to data together with the ability to present the data clearly and efficiently to support business decisions.
* High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to detail
* Great communication skills – someone who can turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
* A true passion for understanding consumers' social gaming behavior and tolerance for ambiguity.


Nice to have's:


* Be a gamer yourself – as a player, you can give different insights and add extra value to your analysis and your work
* Knowledge of statistics, predictive models and machine learning techniques (Python, R)


Here's what we offer you:


* A challenging role in a diverse, international and fast-growing organization with lots of career opportunities
* Hybrid ways of working between home and the office
* A competitive monthly salary
* Bonus incentive
* Monthly Phone Allowance
* Participation in our pension scheme
* 26 vacation days
* 6 powerup weekends
* 1 day off for your birthday
* Lunch benefit
* Christmas, Birthday & Special events gifts

  


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.



If you feel the above describes you perfectly - Apply now!

  


Employee at Playtika? Click here - https://t.ly/6F9Q\_

title: Junior AI Engineer
Data Engineer Data Platform Team
description:
Locatie
Heerlen, Amsterdam
Dienstverband
32-40 uur
Jaren ervaring
0-5 jaar werkervaring
Opleidingsniveau
Master / WO
Salarisindicatie
EUR 4300 – 6000
Publicatiedatum
21 mei 2024
  
### **Dit wordt je functie**

  

  

Data Engineer Data Platform Team

  

Are you a highly-motivated Data Platform Engineer who wants to contribute to the enablement of a data-driven company, our cloud transformation and Agile WoW to help APG Asset Management to become a sustainable and Digital Investments Solutions Provider? Do you have relevant experience in data platform activities in an highly demanding enterprise environment? Do you like to work on a massive digitalization of one of the biggest Asset Managers in Europe? Than read on.

 **The role**


We are looking for a Data Platform Engineer to join the Data Platform Team in the Orchestration & Integration (O&I) department at APG Asset Management. The Data Platform Team has various responsibilities, including delivering fit-for-purpose and reliable tech solutions for our Data Office, provide Data Platform consumers with the means to monitor and control their components and content and (re)create data capabilities to accelerate consumers of the data platform.  

In your role as Data Platform Engineer on the Data Platform team, you will facilitate the consumption of components from our data platform. You will be responsible for building and optimizing the data infrastructure on which our consumers build their data solutions. You will work collaboratively with use case teams, IT-specialists and various other stakeholders. You enjoy laying the technical groundwork to deliver information products. Your key responsibilities will include:

* Building scalable, reusable and future-proof patterns for the data platform.
* Centralize and document business requirements and methodologies (rules, definitions, guardrails).
* Ensure that the data organization system in place is clean, compliant reliable and prepared for any usage scenarios that may arise.
* Keeping abreast of technological developments (in the cloud and other areas) and translating how these innovations can be applied to our data platform.
* Continuously optimize the performance of the company’s data ecosystem.


The Data Platform team is part of the Data Integration team. Apart from Data Integration, the O&I department also consists of a Data Integration Team, an Application Integration Team, a Cloud Competence Centre and Generic Services. Our professional goal is to deliver integrated and seamless IT solutions to ensure a coherent and sustainable IT landscape and experience. Together, we are a technical enablement department that delivers value to the Asset Management organization. We make it possible for our internal DevOps and global engineering teams to focus on delivering business value for their customers.  



**What you would do**


Your daily tasks will involve:

* Designing and implementing the data storage layer with Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2.
* Reading in batched data using Azure Data Factory pipelines, data structures and data connections.
* Transforming data with Azure Databricks-Spark notebooks using the Delta Lake/Parquet format.
* Implementing user authentication and authorization using AAD, applying the principle of least privilege, securing data both at rest and in transit, and enforcing compliance controls for sensitive data.
* Monitoring, managing and optimizing data storage and data processing.
* Managing data backup and recovery, troubleshooting based on metrics and log data using Azure Monitor.
* Setting up and maintaining Azure DevOps repositories to facilitate version control and collaborative development.
* Sharing and transferring knowledge with team members and the broader organization.
* Providing support for testing activities and implementations.

 **What you bring**


You think in terms of opportunities and are service-minded. You find taking responsibility and accepting responsibilities comes naturally to you. You have a pragmatic attitude and are motivated to deliver quality. You are willing to develop or improve your T-shaped skills. You also have:

* A bachelor degree in Computer Science/Engineering or comparable.
* 3-5 years’ relevant experience
* Hands-on experience with Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps
* Hands on experience with Bicep and Terraform templates usage in pipeline as code
* Scripting knowledge (Powershell, Azure CLI)
* Technical expertise in Data Engineering, Data Architecture, Python, Pyspark and Parquet are considered a pre.
* Have an automate first mindset and deliver via CI/CD
* Familiarity with Agile practices. Willingness to be part of a DevOps team.
* Business skills such as curiosity, resilience, autonomy, innovative mindset and team player.
* You live in the Netherlands or its proximity and are fluent in spoken and written English.

  



**What we offer you**


We will offer you a gross salary of up to 6.000,- euro gross per month (40 hrs) and great employment conditions aimed at flexibility, such as:


* A guaranteed end of year bonus of 8.33%
* Attention to your vitality and personal development
* Possibility to work from home 2-3 days per week
* And obviously a well-managed pension

  



**Where you will work**


For pension provider APG, pension is about people, life, and living together. With careful asset management, pension administration, communication and advice, we work on a livable future for current and future generations. One in which we share prosperity and well-being fairly and sustainably. Now and later.


APG is committed to around 4.5 million people in the Netherlands, which is why we believe it is important to be a reflection of Dutch society. This means that APG strives for an inclusive work environment, in which everyone can be themselves and where your unique qualities are embraced.


When you choose to work for APG, you choose for a job in which you contribute to a bright future. Apply today!

  



**More information**


Get in touch with Ed Rinkel via +31623703426 or ed.rinkel@apg.nl or Hiring Manager Heidi van de Loosdrecht via heidi.vande.loosdrecht@apg-am.nl who can tell you more about the specifics of the position.


Do you see your future at APG?


*We do not appreciate acquisition in response to this vacancy*


  
### **Dit wordt je functie**

  

  

Data Engineer Data Platform Team

  

Are you a highly-motivated Data Platform Engineer who wants to contribute to the enablement of a data-driven company, our cloud transformation and Agile WoW to help APG Asset Management to become a sustainable and Digital Investments Solutions Provider? Do you have relevant experience in data platform activities in an highly demanding enterprise environment? title: Compliance AML Analytics Expert
company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Compliance Analyst
description:
**This is Adyen**



Adyen provides payments, data, and financial products in a single solution for customers like Meta, Uber, H&M, and Microsoft - making us the financial technology platform of choice. At Adyen, everything we do is engineered for ambition.



For our teams, we create an environment with opportunities for our people to succeed, backed by the culture and support to ensure they are enabled to truly own their careers. We are motivated individuals who tackle unique technical challenges at scale and solve them as a team. Together, we deliver innovative and ethical solutions that help businesses achieve their ambitions faster.


**Compliance Data**



Adyen is looking for a passionate and skilled Data Analyst to join our team in Amsterdam and contribute to our mission of understanding and managing the risks we as a company face. Your expertise in data analysis and problem-solving will be instrumental to derive impactful insights that help us build strong products that allow Adyen to grow sustainably.


**What you'll do**


* **Collaborative Development:** You'll work closely with our global Compliance and Product teams, Data Engineers, and other Data Analysts in ideating, building and evaluating data solutions to meet business needs.
* **Data Analysis and Insights**: Analyze customer, transaction, and risk data to unlock actionable insights and improvement opportunities. Provide data-driven recommendations to reduce our risks.
* **Problem Solving and Impact-Oriented**: Proactively identify opportunities through comprehensive data analysis. Develop data models and perform statistical analysis to support strategic business decisions. Initiate and drive new projects to help Adyen reduce risks significantly, while keeping scale and growth in mind.
* **Strategic Leadership**: Use data insights to proactively shape and drive strategy across our Compliance teams. Influence priorities both in Compliance and Product with data-driven insights.
* **Tool Development:** Design and build impactful tooling that structurally adds value to our Compliance teams and develop scalable solutions that enhance data accessibility and usability for stakeholders.


**Who you are**


* **Experienced Data Analyst:** 3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst or in a similar role.
* **Technical and Strategic Hybrid:** A blend of technical expertise and strategic thinking.
* **Technical Super Star:**
	+ Proficient Python and SQL. Strong with BI tools, Looker being a big plus.
	+ Experience with big data tooling, i.e. PySpark, Hadoop and Airflow.
* **Great Communicator**: Able to effectively communicate complex data-related concepts and outcomes to a diverse range of (non-technical) stakeholders.
* **Self-starter**: Proactive in identifying opportunities, devising solutions, and managing projects independently.
* **Strategic Thinker:** Able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, prioritize tasks, and maximize impact through strategic influence.
* **Innovative Mindset:** You have an experimental and curious mindset with a 'launch fast and iterate' mentality.
* **Global Mindset**: Able to interface seamlessly with a global, multicultural team (excellent collaboration skills, culturally aware, both internally and with customers) and enthusiastic and open to meet with the teams globally.


**Good to know**


* This role is based out of our Amsterdam office, but has an international (EMEA, NA & LATAM) scope.
* We have a hybrid work arrangement, meaning at least three days per week from the office.
* This is a full-time position.


**Our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion commitments**



Our unobvious approach is a product of our diverse perspectives. This diversity of backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives is essential in helping us maintain our momentum. Our business and technical challenges are unique, we need as many different voices as possible to join us in solving them - voices like yours. So no matter where you're from, who you love, or what you believe in, we welcome you to be your true self at Adyen.



Studies show that women and members of underrepresented communities apply for jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Does it sound like you? If so, Adyen encourages you to reconsider and apply. We look forward to your application.


**What's next?**



Ensuring a smooth and enjoyable candidate experience is critical for us. We aim to get back to you regarding your application within 5 business days. Our interview process tends to take about 4 weeks to complete, but may fluctuate depending on the role. Learn more about our hiring process here. Don't be afraid to let us know if you need more flexibility.
company_description: The Only Payment Solution You'll Ever Need | Wherever People Pay

title: Data Engineer - Azure Databricks
description:
Data Engineer - Azure Databricks**At a glance**
---------------


Are you passionate about working with financial data, do you have hands-on experience with data engineering techniques, and do you want to help us build a finance domain data store? Then we believe we have a great opportunity for you.


We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our team. At the moment 18 professionals are working together from different expertise areas to create high quality data marts and reports.

**Your job**
------------


We are looking for a data engineer with passion, overview and technical skills. As a member of a DevOps team you are responsible for development but also daily operations. In a short period of time you are able to obtain extensive knowledge of our large and complex data models to be able to make the necessary future changes, support production or to support new requirements.


Additionally, you can help existing data engineers with challenges in Databricks by using PySpark and SQL and implement business requirements.


Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organises work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be working as a Data Engineer within the finance domain in a dynamic and energetic team of professionals who all are critical thinkers and share the same passion. We are ambitious and learning every day. We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment with many opportunities for innovation. We provide personal development opportunities and encourage co-working with stakeholders to come up with the best solutions for their needs.

**Your profile**
----------------


You are up to date with the latest developments in data engineering and Databricks. The job requires excellent analytical skills and an eye for detail.

* You have an affinity with financial reporting
* Strong analytic skills, data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling
* Expertise in Azure Databricks, Python, PySpark and SQL (must)
* Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets (must)
* Experience in data modelling and Kimball methodology (must)
* Experience in stakeholder management
* Experience with Azure DevOps, Boards, Git repositories, Pipelines
* Experience with data management, data governance, DQ, and meta data
* Pro-active attitude and an excellent team player.
* You are at least AZ-900 certified or willing to pass within 3 month.
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills.
* A good work-life balance
* The opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionally
* A hybrid way of working
* A salary ranging from 4345.- to 6207.- per month based on a 36-hour workweek and a seniority level
* A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefits
* A personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per year
* An annual public transportation pass
* A solid pension plan
**Interested?**
---------------


If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact marc.veldt@nl.abnamro.com (Chapter Lead)

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

### **Wij vragen**

* Samenwerkingsgerichtheid
* Passie voor je vakgebied
