title: Azure Data Engineer
description:
Ben je op zoek naar een uitdagende rol binnen een dynamisch bedrijf, waarbij je een robuuste data-infrastructuur op het Azure-platform ontwerpt, bouwt, implementeert en onderhoudt? Dan is Athora op zoek naar jou!

  

Als een van de grootste pensioenverzekeraars van Nederland speelt Athora Netherlands, met Zwitserleven als voornaamste merk, een belangrijke rol in het leven van onze klanten. Wij zorgen voor hun inkomen van morgen en maken daarom regelmatig keuzes die de wereld van morgen beïnvloeden.

  

Bij Athora werken we aan de beste versie van onszelf en aan een cultuur waarin vier gedragsprincipes centraal staan: Haal het beste uit jezelf (en haal het beste uit anderen), Sta voor wat je doet (en doe wat je zegt), Ga voor het beste (en maak beter wat goed is), Focus op resultaten (want resultaten geven richting). Binnen onze organisatie staan mensen, samenwerking en klantgerichtheid centraal. We werken samen aan en creëren een inclusieve werkomgeving waarin iedereen kan floreren.

 **Azure Data Engineer**



Als Azure Data Engineer speel je een sleutelrol bij het ontwerpen, bouwen, implementeren en onderhouden van een robuuste data-infrastructuur op het Azure-platform. Je verbindt, structureert en maakt data beschikbaar op een manier die onze organisatie een concurrentievoordeel geeft en ons helpt een echt data-gedreven organisatie te worden. Je optimaliseert datastromen voor betere prestaties en schaalbaarheid en werkt samen in multidisciplinaire teams om organisatorische behoeften om te zetten in technische oplossingen. Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar relevante werkervaring in een data-omgeving.

 **Wat breng je mee?**


* Kennis van Python (geavanceerd, object georiënteerd, design patterns)
* Kennis van Databricks (Pyspark, Spark SQL)
* Kennis van Azure Datawarehouse omgeving (DP-900, DP203)
* Bekend met de toepassing van gangbare Data Lake en Data Warehouse patronen en methodologieën
* Kennis van Azure DevOps (Git, YAML Pipelines)
* Kennis van de Microsoft BI stack:
	+ PowerBI
	+ Bekend met Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL)
	+ Bekend met SSIS/SSAS
* Ervaring met datamigraties
* Agile Safe
* Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift.


**Competenties**


* Je bedenkt graag creatieve en innovatieve oplossingen en bent resultaatgericht
* Je waardeert het om samen te werken en te sparren met collega’s, maar kunt ook zelfstandig werken
* Je bent nieuwsgierig en wilt altijd blijven leren binnen en buiten je eigen vakgebied
* Je hebt een goed gevoel voor humor!


**Wij bieden**


* Een moderne en dynamische werkomgeving met fijne collega's
* Een goede balans tussen werken op kantoor en thuis
* Ruime mogelijkheden voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
* Flexibele werktijden met aandacht voor gezondheid en vitaliteit
* Een goed salaris en een 13e maand


**Geïnteresseerd?**



Solliciteer nu, kom met ons praten en sluit je aan bij het innovatieve en gepassioneerde team! Als je vragen hebt of meer informatie wilt, neem dan gerust contact op met Eveline via recruitment@athora.nl

 *Een Pre-Employment Screening is onderdeel van het Athora onboardingsproces.*

  



Athora is committed to diversity and being an inclusive employer. Click here to find out more Diversiteit en inclusie (athora.nl)

title: Data Engineering Lead
description:
We are looking for an experienced professional to join our Data Engineering Team. As a Data Engineering Lead, you are responsible for all data landscape and data processes of our clients. We are Azure oriented, but also we love open source and clouds such as AWS and GCP.

**Who we are**
--------------



Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering Big Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.


With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.


We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.  



  

**What we offer**
-----------------


* Interact with senior stakeholders at our clients on regular basis to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Become the go-to person for end-to-end data handling, management, and analytics processes.
* Lead your team in creating the pipeline for Data management, data visualization, and analytics products, including automated services, and APIs.
* Working with Data Scientists to take data throughout its lifecycle - acquisition, exploration, data cleaning, integration, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.
* Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

  

  



**What you will do**
--------------------


* Lead, influence & implement the technical roadmap of our clients, in light of overall technology and architecture roadmaps.
* Be responsible for the Architecture, making sure that technical and non-technical components work together in the product to deliver the customer needs.
* Lead and Develop the digital development and operations using Python, Spark, RESTful API, and Microsoft Azure Cloud, ideally with some Data Insights experience.
* Steer the technical excellence of the application and consistency with relevant digital frameworks, best practices, and standards.
* Coach and enable other product team members to deliver best-in-class products.
* Deliver data platforms, data insights and with the collaboration of the data science team – data products, such as recommendation systems, data lakes/hubs, data insights and dashboards.
* Lead project activities and will be responsible for the evaluation of business needs and objectives in collaboration with the project team and other stakeholders.

  



**What you’ll bring**
---------------------

* 5-8 years of experience in a similar role with experience in developing and deploying ETL solutions on Azure.
* Solid knowledge of data warehousing principles, concepts, and best practices (e.g. ODS, data marts, data lakes, data vault, 3NF).
* Good understanding of common platforms and practices regarding digital development; Cloud-based setups, Advanced Analytics and computing environments, and GitHub (or similar) and CI/CD workflows.
* Experience in setting up automated testing frameworks including unit tests, integration tests.
* Understanding of modern cloud-based architecture (Lambda & Kappa architectures).
* Advanced SQL, data transformation, and data profiling skills.
* Experience in building production ETL/ELT pipelines at scale.
* Data governance experience.
* 3-5 years of hands-on experience with Azure: Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse (DWH), Azure Functions, App logic, and other data analytics services, including streaming.
* Experience with Airflow, Kubernetes, Great expectations is a plus.
* Programming languages: Python (PySpark), scripting languages like Bash.
* Basic knowledge of PowerBI is a plus.
* Customer-centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services.
* Demonstrating true engineering craftsmanship mindset.
* Passionate about continuous improvement and working collaboratively.
* Strong problem-solving skills coupled with the ability to convey designs and ideas to a wider audience.
* People Management experience (at least 2 members team).
* Experience in service consulting and stakeholder management.
* Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous.
* A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, Operations Research. Statistics, Business or other related technical disciplines (Master's Degree is a plus).

  

In a changing world, diversity and inclusion are core values for team well-being and performance. At Metyis, we want to welcome and retain all talents, regardless of gender, age, origin or sexual orientation, and irrespective of whether or not they are living with a disability, as each of them has their own experience and identity.

title: Senior Azure Developer Tribe CreditCore
description:
**Your work environment within Tribe CreditCore:**


Tribe CreditCore delivers centrally managed group functionality such that Business Units can optimally carry out their end-to-end credit process. We monitor quality of data and portfolios providing insight to continuously improve the end-to-end credit process. We increase trust from the regulator and from the public and we achieve uniformity, simplification and efficiency in the Credit Journey within the bank.


Through the creation of a central overview and by accurately monitoring the portfolios we offer actionable data to the group to improve quality of processes and decisions. Our credit risk framework is the foundation for clear and consistent implementations of global standards that adhere to regulation and ensures protection against inadmissible credit risk.


The area Credit Risk Origination and Services (COS) consists of 10 squads, organized around our purpose:


We create the best Credit Origination experience with central insights and innovative and compliant services, to better help our clients and select better clients globally.


Simplify, accelerate and harmonize credit origination across the business units, while enhancing Business Unit competitiveness.


As a Senior Azure Developer, you will be part of a diverse and enthusiastic team that takes ownership to deliver end-to-end solutions for a broad range of stakeholders. You bring your wide experience and knowledge to the team and contribute to increase the maturity of the team. You like to coach others and be a real team player that is used to working in a scrum team, has substantial knowledge about the scrum process and can work in a DevOps team.

**You recognize yourself from the description below:**

* 7+ years working experience as Senior Developer with knowledge on ETL processes and .NET (C#)
* Hands on experience with Azure Cloud services.
* Knowledge about architecting and developing maintainable and scalable software
* Excellent communication skills and a team player
* Experience in international IT projects English speaking and writing, (Dutch nice to have)
* Experience with the Agile way of working
* Experience with Azure DevOps
* Curious, analytic, pro-active, determined, result driven and not afraid to share his/her opinion

**Required:**

* Azure Cloud solutions (Azure App Services, Azure Functions, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks)
* Python, Pyspark, SparkSql
* C# (.NET Core/.NET 6 and higher)
* ASP.NET Core
* SQL, SQL Database / DWH
* Azure DevOps, GIT, CI/CD
* OOP principles, SOLID, DDD, Design Patterns
* Entity Framework (Core)
* Web API’s / Swagger/ REST / Open API
* Unit Testing / TDD / Mocking Frameworks

**Nice to have:**

* Knowledge of PyTest library
* Experience with YAML, Azure CLI, PowerShell
* Experience with Microservices
* Experience with finance or banking systems and processes

**This is what we offer you**


* a gross monthly salary between €4.292,- and €6.130,- (scale 9, 36 hours per week).
* 13th month and holiday pay: the holiday allowance and annual allowance will usually be paid out in 12 equal monthly instalments. Employees have the option once a year to opt for the holiday allowance to be paid out in May and the annual allowance in December.
* an Employee Benefit Budget (11% of your monthly salary). You decide how to spend this budget. This may include purchasing extra leave days, making extra pension contributions, or even receiving a monthly cash pay-out.
* an annual personal development/training budget of € 1.400,-
* 100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transport! Do you still prefer to travel by car or motorbike? Then choose a commuting allowance.
* a monthly € 40,- net work from home allowance, based on working from home 5 days per week.
* a monthly € 40,- net internet allowance.
* Attractive pension fund with a personal contribution of only 5.5%. Rabobank will contribute 21.5%.


This is a selection of the terms of employment for an Azure Developer based on a 36-hour working week (40 hours possible). You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.


**You and the job application process**


* Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Dino Dzankovic, IT Recruiter, via dino.dzankovic@rabobank.nl
* We will hold the interviews through a video call.
* You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.
* A security check is part of the process.


#LI-DD1 #Azure #Cloud #.NET #Python #SoftwareEngineer #ITjobs

title: Data Engineer | Conversational AI
description:
Data Engineer | Conversational AI**At a glance**
---------------


We are looking for an enthusiastic colleague that will help us shape the future of Conversational AI at ABN AMRO in the role of an engineering who can maintain and improve our Conversational AI workflows by automating the data and ml processes used within the team to improve solutions like Chatbot Anna, Conversational IVR (Voicebot) and LLM-based Advisor Assist.

**Your job**
------------


Thousands of customers interact with ABN AMRO on a weekly basis. We want to make sure that these conversations are getting resolved in an effective and friction free manner.


Here at Team Advanced Conversational Engagement, part of the Customer Interaction Domain, we maintain and innovate on top of our conversational bot, Interactive voice response (IVR), and internal Advisor Assist tooling.


In the Cognition team we are responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and innovating our conversational solutions to ensure they meet evolving customer needs and industry standards.


Subjects you might be working on include: Setting up a medallion data architecture for analyses workflows, implementing pipelines to evaluate LLM prompts, implementing pipelines to evaluate classification algorithms, design how we store and manually annotate data etc.


Most recently we are in a middle of a massive migration from a major cloud based conversational AI platform to MS Copilot while attempting to empower our solutions with LLMs in a manner that is responsible, secure and reliable within the standards of ABN AMRO.

**Working environment**
-----------------------


You will be part of a multidisciplinary scrum team of data scientists, engineers and consultants.


In the extended team (~50 colleagues) you will be working alongside data engineers, user experience designers, content writers and front- and backend developers.

**Your profile**
----------------

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in a professional IT environment (you encountered GIT, CICD, OOP, unit testing, REST, SQL/NoSQL, docker);
* Able to effectively communicate (in written and spoken English) about your analyses and results;
* Strong programming skills with Python/Pyspark, focus on data (pre)processing and data handling;
* Databricks (delta live tables, compute, delta lake) or similar;
* Experience with a cloud environment (Azure);
* Pro-active, curious attitude and an excellent team player;
* Ability to independently take ownership over epics, plan and manage the epic and communicate with stakeholders;
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home (in consultation with your team and depending on your position).
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. In addition, a recruitment agency can only submit a resume when invited by a Talent Acquisition Specialist to join the search for a right candidate. All unsolicited resumes sent to us will be considered property of ABN AMRO BANK N.V. In this case, ABN AMRO will not be held liable to pay a placement fee.

### **Wij bieden**

* Een procesmatige aanpak

### **Wij vragen**

* Een creatief brein
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Data Scientist II - Experimentation team
description:
At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.


### **Role description**


**As a Data Scientist in the Experimentation Science Team, you focus on scalable solutions to the company’s most persistent challenges in decision making. You provide support to experimenters across the company, investigate problems and define clear solutions and requirements for their implementation, build proofs of concept and prototypes, and work closely with the engineering teams to support our product vision. The ability to write high quality, reproducible code and dig into technical product details and data pipelines is crucial to make your work impactfully landed in the Experimentation Tool, and enable solid decision making adoptable by a wide range of experimenters!**



As a Data Scientist II, you’ll take full ownership of the design and delivery of data science solutions, from ideation to implementation. You are expected to combine sound business understanding, data handling, programming, statistical modeling and data visualization to derive actionable information from broad sets of data while valuing pragmatism over perfection.



In the meantime, you are also part of a data science team, and work with partners throughout the company, to generate understanding, strategy and guide key decision making based on data. It involves applying suitable statistical data analysis and modeling methods to solve sophisticated business problems, independently identify and lead partners, and effectively communicate complex analysis results.


**Key Job Responsibilities and Duties**


* Responsible for owning the design and delivery of entire Data Science solutions based on business requirements, bringing them from the initial idea-generation phase to implementation independently.
* Responsible for working autonomously on consuming data, preparing it for data science use, translating business problems to data stories and solving them effectively by applying suitable statistical data analysis and modeling methods. Leverages input from business stakeholders in all of the above to determine the right technical solutions to deliver customer value.
* Responsible for working primarily within the scope of their team to deliver work that informs business decisions for the product / business topic they currently work on, occasionally collaborating across multiple teams.
* Responsible for designing and interpreting quantitative experiments to objectively guide key business decision making.
* Responsible for independently identifying and handling stakeholders in operational, project-based, and managerial roles. Effectively communicates, addresses collaborators' needs, and conveys complex analysis results in a clear manner. Begins to guide junior colleagues in stakeholder engagement.
* Responsible for being flexible in adopting existing internal and external Data Science approaches, proposing and spotting opportunities to apply new approaches and expanding their technical competencies and their peer’s when a more efficient way presents itself.
* Responsible for leveraging Data Science for impact while learning to incorporate scalability, reproducibility and long term orientation in their work.
* Responsible for acting as a force multiplier for junior peers in the team by actively helping them with their craft through means of coaching, mentoring and setting a good example.
* Responsible for contributing to the community of their area by supporting community projects aimed at making other data professional more effective, actively participating in community strengthening activities (ie. recruitment) and connecting with peers beyond their area.
* Responsible for collaborating with peers in related crafts (ie. Data Engineering), anticipating data needs to ensure smooth progress of their individual projects.
* Responsible for ensuring quality of their own work by validating it through peer review.
* Responsible for influencing business decisions within their specific area (ie. product team)


**Role qualifications and requirements**


* Proficient in Pyspark and general Python
* Solid understanding of statistical and hypothesis testing
* Experience working closely with product teams (not just PMs, but directly with developers/engineers)
* Willingness to dig deep into problems and behind the scenes data to support troubleshooting/bug fixing
* Solution oriented and result driven
* Able to brainstorm, peer review and drive research topics benefit Experimentation and Decision Making in both short and long term
* Excellent English communication skills, both written and verbal; the ability to convey your message to team members and other partners, clearly and gently.
* Achieve impacts as a great teammate, and maintain solid relationships with technical and non technical collaborators.


The following skills are assets for this role:


* Knowledgeable about statistical properties of (good) metrics, and ability to scalably test them
* Causal inference knowledge beyond A/B testing
* Understand the gist of scripts written in R
* Experience building libraries/modules in python
* Familiarity with apis using is good, building/maintaining is great
* Good understanding of fundamental machine learning concepts
* Solid understanding of reporting/visualization techniques (e.g., Tableau, Graphite, Power BI, etc.)

  


**DEI****: Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Booking.com**



Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) have been a core part of our company culture since day one. This ongoing journey starts with our very own employees, who represent over 140 nationalities and a wide range of ethnic and social backgrounds, genders and sexual orientations. Take it from our Chief People Officer, Paulo Pisano: “At Booking.com, the diversity of our people doesn’t just create a unique workplace, it also creates a better and more inclusive travel experience for everyone.”



We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable adjustments to participate in the interview process. Please contact us to request adjustments.


**Career Development Opportunities**


* Bi-annual performance conversations, company-wide mentoring program, and internal development opportunities
* Unlimited access to online learning platforms: Udemy, Coursera, LinkedIn learning, O'reilly


**Application Process**


* The interview process for this role entails a total of 3 interviews.


*Booking.com is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We strive to move well beyond traditional equal opportunity and work to create an environment that allows everyone to thrive.*

**Pre-****Employment****Screening:**  

  

If your application is successful, your personal data may be used for a pre-employment screening check by a third party as permitted by applicable law. Depending on the vacancy and applicable law, a pre-employment screening may include employment history, education and other information (such as media information) that may be necessary for determining your qualifications and suitability for the position.
company_description: Making it easier for everyone to experience the world.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**ING is looking for an Experienced Data Scientist in the Tribe Digital, Assisted Channels & Customer Interactions**


We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to lead one of our data science initiatives. The ideal candidate brings extensive expertise in statistical modeling, machine learning, and data analytics. In addition to technical proficiency, strong interpersonal skills are a must, as you will collaborate cross-functionally, guide and mentor junior team members, and lead projects from inception to implementation.

**The team**


At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital & Customer Interactions drives digital sales and develops digital interactions with customers. With over 70 data analysts and scientists, we accelerate the transition towards becoming a fully data-driven organization. We work in multi-disciplinary teams, allocated as data consultants both internally and externally to our tribe.


At ING we promote diversity and want to make our teams a reflection of our world. If you recognize yourself in the description below, but your profile doesn't match the job description 100%, don't hesitate to apply.

 **Roles and responsibilities**


We value innovation and expect you to explore new use cases, contributing to our evolving data-driven strategies. Proficiency in data exploration, visualization, and storytelling is crucial for transforming complex findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical stakeholders. If you are a seasoned data scientist with a passion for innovation, ready to drive impactful insights and committed to personal growth, we want you on our team.

 **How to succeed**


We hire smart people like you for your potential. Our biggest expectation is that you’ll stay curious. Keep learning. Take on responsibility. In return, we’ll back you to develop into an even more awesome version of yourself.

  

* An MSc or Ph.D. with excellent academic results in the field of Computer Science, Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields.
* 4+ years of relevant and demonstrable experience in the field of data science.
* Both broad and in-depth knowledge of machine Learning techniques: Classification, Regression, Clustering, Text Mining and Deep Learning.
* Experience with programming Languages and tools including Python, PySpark, SQL, Git, Shell.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms, particularly GCP and BigQuery is a plus.
* You embrace writing readable, documented and efficient code.
* You are not afraid to learn new technologies and help work through data engineering partnerships.
* Understanding of model lifecycles and monitoring including developing and bringing models to production.
* Demonstrated experience successfully collaborating in cross-functional teams including business, engineering and data science stakeholders.
* Experience in working in an Agile/Scrum is also a plus.
* You are open to feedback and growth on technical skills, business applications, and soft skills.
* You are fluent in written and spoken English. Dutch is a plus.

 **Rewards and benefits**


We want to make sure that it’s possible for you to strike the right balance between your career and your private life. You can find out more about our employment conditions at https://www.ing.jobs/netherlands/Why-ING/benefits.htm

  

The benefits of working with us at ING include:

* A salary tailored to your qualities and experience
* 24-27 vacation days depending on contract
* Pension scheme
* 13th month salary
* Individual Savings Contribution (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* 8% Holiday payment
* Hybrid working to blend home working for focus and office working for collaboration and co-creation
* Personal growth and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with innovative colleagues

 **About us**


With 60,000 employees and operations in approximately 40 countries, there is no shortage of opportunities for people with initiative who want to help people take a step ahead in life and in business. Do you want to work at the cutting edge of what’s possible and at the same time ensure you work with integrity and hold the customer’s interests at heart? Do you want to be surrounded by progressive, inspiring, diverse and supportive colleagues? Then there is no better place to invest your talents than at ING.  

Join us. Apply today.

**Questions?**


Contact the recruiter attached to the advertisement for more information. Want to apply directly? Please upload your CV and motivation letter by clicking the “Apply” button.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Senior Analytics Engineer
description:
**About HousingAnywhere**



HousingAnywhere is Europe's largest mid-term rental platform. With Kamernet and Studapart under its umbrella, it represents three fast-growing brands with over 30 million yearly unique visitors combined, 160,000+ properties available for rent and 100,000+ tenants securing their new homes, based on the 2022 performance. HousingAnywhere serves young professionals and students, primarily aged between 18 and 35, connecting them with accommodation providers. Through its advanced technology platform, tenants rent accommodation for 3 to 12 months outside of their country of origin. Headquartered in Rotterdam, HousingAnywhere operates in most European cities and recently expanded to key cities in the US, establishing a presence in over 125 cities. Driven by the mission to enable people to live wherever and however they choose, thanks to a flexible renting experience, the technology scale-up employs 340 professionals globally.

  


**Our mission**



Rent Easy, Live Free.



We are empowering people to live wherever and however they choose. To find comfort and peace of mind on the other side of the world or the other side of town. All while feeling confident and totally at ease, whatever their adventure might involve. We are doing it by creating a new standard of renting. Safe. Harmonious. More options. Less hassle. With the help of our trusted networks of landlords and partners.

  


**Our** **Values**


* Ownership
* We are Enablers
* We are Changemakers
* We are Connectors

  


**The team**



This role will be part of the Analytics Engineering team, which is part of the Data Science & Engineering organisation. This organisation also consists of Data Engineering and Data Science teams. The Analytics Engineering team has the mandate to democratise access to insights by building Data Models in our Enterprise Data Warehouse.

  


**Our Stack**



At HousingAnywhere, our data warehouse is powered by Snowflake. Our data pipelines are built using Stitch and dbt cloud and Airflow. We use Rudderstack as our preferred CDP. We use Tableau as our Visualization tool and Mixpanel for Product Analytics.

  


**Your role & Impact**



Analytics Engineers are responsible for translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


* Partner with our business stakeholders, BI analysts and other engineering team members to collect data needs - and translate this into functioning pipelines and data models
* Build, and maintain efficient & reliable data models and pipelines for both external and internal data in partnership with data engineering
* Perform root cause analysis in case of issues in data production processes
* Ensure our colleagues are able to optimally use the data models via documentation, training, and monitoring of best practices

  


**Your profile**


* At least 5 years of experience in building data marts/data models and performing adhoc analysis on large datasets
* At least 2 years of working experience working with dbt
* Strong knowledge in SQL, Data Modelling
* Good business modelling skills to transform stakeholders requirements into an actual data model.
* Software engineering experience in a programming language, preferably in Python.
* Experience using code repositories is highly desirable.
* Experience using a data visualisation tool is a plus.

  


**What's in it for you**


* Diverse international community (46+ nationalities).
* Hybrid working policy (2 days working from office in Rotterdam).
* Unlimited paid holidays, minimum-based not maximum.
* 1,000 EUR personal development budget.
* Complete coverage for commuting.
* Personal equipment, including laptop and ergonomic setup.
* 30% ruling application assistance.
* Gym membership discount with GoVital or OneFit.
* Variable pension scheme.
* Dutch/English classes budget.
* Fun team-building and after-work drinks every Friday.

  


*If you have further questions, please email* *y.kaboorappan@housinganywhere.com*


*By applying to work at HousingAnywhere, you agree to our* *Candidate Privacy Policy*
company_description: We have the mission to help with housing, anywhere. We want to build a safe, efficient and global rental marketplace for anyone looking for or renting out a place. We Care. We Perform. We Evolve.

title: Marketing Data Trainee
description:
Position Summary
Are you a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in Marketing and Data? Do you have a passion for technology and innovation? Samsung is seeking ambitious, commercial-minded, and collaborative individuals to join our dynamic organization.  

  

About the Traineeship:  

Our 3-year Traineeship is designed to equip you with the skills and experience necessary to excel in the competitive world of Marketing and Data. Working for a major international global player like Samsung offers you, as a trainee, huge opportunities for hands-on experience. During this program, each year you will have the opportunity to make a difference and learn from the best in different key positions at Samsung that match your area of expertise. Besides hands-on experience, you also get the opportunity to personally develop yourself during our various learning tracks imbedded in the trainee program together with your fellow trainees.  

  

Don't limit your talents! Give them the freedom to grow with us. So what are you waiting for? #DoWhatYouCant and become our next Samsung trainee.
Role and Responsibilities
Representing the brand, you radiate confidence and professionalism in an inspiring way. In this way, you actively contribute to the further growth of Samsung.
This means that you are responsible for the following:
Consumer Market Insight* Insight generation by “connecting the dots” across various data sources to create comprehensive consumer insight.
* Tracking brand equity and attributes, campaign effectiveness test, and marketing performance
* Consumer (survey) research to uncover the “why” behind consumer behavior


Marketing Data Analysis* Generate and deliver comprehensive and actionable insights
* Creating overview & recommending improvements across various marketing channels: web, digital/social media, CRM, PR/Influencer, and e-commerce data.
* Data visualization and data-driven storytelling for marketing and e-commerce strategy development


Data-driven Personalization through CRM, Digital Media and Web Analytics* Loyalty insight such as performance on acquisition, retention and churn using various data sources and tools.
* Advise optimizing the customer journey on Samsung.com using Adobe Analytics and GA4 data
* Manage, analyze and report A/B tests to optimize the customer journey
* Connects the dots between .com analytics, Ads platforms and CRM data
* Ensure tag implementation allows for correct dataflow and GDPR/Privacy requirements


Stakeholder Engagement to make insights actionable* Stakeholder engagement to have insights actionable using various communication and engagement channels
* Tracking the impact of insights based on the Insight tracking framework


Responsibility Expansion: As you develop and demonstrate your capabilities during the traineeship, your responsibilities will increase accordingly, providing you with more opportunities to take on greater challenges and responsibilities.
This traineeship position is part of our specialized Marketing Data Analytics Track. Meaning that within the three-year traineeship program you will develop yourself on the following topics to become a well-rounded Marketing & Data professional:* Year 1: Consumer Market Insight (CM – D&A)
* Year 2: MI/BI Data Analysis (Sales Division)
* Year 3: Marketing Data Analysis (CM - D&A) for Web, CRM, Digital Media, and MarTech


Skills and Qualifications* You hold a master's degree, preferably in Marketing, Strategy, Business Administration, Econometrics, Economics (Business economics), statistics, or a related field
* Knowledge of Statistics or Econometrics
* You are enterprising, ambitious, like to take initiative and you stand firm in your shoes
* You are innovative (we move fast and take big risks)
* You are passionate (we reveal in what we do)
* You are collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together)
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* You are communicative, customer-oriented, and proactive.


What do we offer?* A competitive salary: As a trainee, you deserve a good start and a good salary which is yearly reviewed.
* Time for a bonus: Have you really done well? Then we can reward you with a quarterly bonus.
* Let's get healthy: With our wellbeing programs, initiatives and office gym, you are well on your way to a healthy lifestyle.
* Health Insurance & Pension: You can participate in our well-regulated collective health insurance and pension scheme.
* Develop your talents: Work on all your talents with our dedicated and tailored training program.
* Events & Extras: Get discounts on our Samsung Employee Webshop and get ready for epic events throughout the year.

  

How to Apply
Ready to take the next step in your career with Samsung? Apply now by submitting your resume explaining why you’re the perfect fit for our Traineeship kick starting per September 1st.

title: Advanced Analytics Trainee
description:
Position Summary
Are you a recent graduate looking to kickstart your career in sales, marketing or data? Do you have a passion for technology and innovation? Samsung is seeking ambitious, commercial-minded, and collaborative individuals to join our dynamic organization.  

  

About the Traineeship:  

Our 3-year Traineeship is designed to equip you with the skills and experience necessary to excel in the competitive world of sales, marketing or data. Working for a major international global player like Samsung offers you, as a trainee, huge opportunities for hands-on experience. During this program, each year you will have the opportunity to make a difference and learn from the best in different key positions at Samsung that match your area of expertise. Besides hands-on experience, you also get the opportunity to personally develop yourself during our various learning tracks imbedded in the trainee program together with your fellow trainees.  

  

Don't limit your talents! Give them the freedom to grow with us. So what are you waiting for? #DoWhatYouCant and become our next Samsung trainee.
Role and Responsibilities
Representing the brand, you radiate confidence and professionalism in an inspiring way. In this way, you actively contribute to the further growth of Samsung.
This means that you are responsible for the following:
Data Engineering* Collect and connect data from different sources according to business needs, use cases, potential exploitation and deployment, and technology possibilities: GCP, Azure, and on-premise servers
* Model raw data into clean, tested, and reusable datasets, make it easier for business analysts and other stakeholders to view and understand data in DB
* Apply various transformations (ETL, ELT) to different data pieces to ensure they correspond to given tasks


Data Science and Machine Learning* Develop data science and machine learning models with the goal of improving revenue from marketing campaigns
* Identify key customer segmentation and support the personalization of marketing communication for precision audience targeting
* Support pricing strategy and manage pricing models


BI dashboard development* Support simulation and data visualization projects
* Convert data into a suitable graphic format including - dashboards, graphs, charts, and reports using BI tools
* Support automated/self-serving data visualization projects by building the foundation layer for dashboard reporting.


Stakeholder engagement to make insights actionable* Map requirements and projects from stakeholders, including business divisions and Marketing Channels, and Marketing Strategy teams.
* Evangelize the data-driven decision-making to the stakeholders while communicating in a plain and intuitive language so that stakeholders easily follow even the sophisticated and technical concepts.
* Establish collaboration with European and global teams working on projects as mentioned above.


Responsibility Expansion: As you develop and demonstrate your capabilities during the traineeship, your responsibilities will increase accordingly, providing you with more opportunities to take on greater challenges and responsibilities.
This traineeship position is part of our specialized Advanced Analytics Track. Meaning that within the three-year traineeship program you will develop yourself on the following topics to become well-rounded analytics professional:* Year 1: Data Engineering (CM – D&A)
* Year 2: Data Science (CM – D&A)
* Year 3: BI development (CM - D&A)


Skills and Qualifications
Are you the one we are looking for?* You hold a master's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Econometrics, Economics (Business economics), Quantitative Marketing, Business Informatics, or a related field
* Knowledge and skills in data engineering, API and cloud computing (GCP, Azure and Databricks)
* Knowledge and skills in SQL/Big Query and Python for data processing and data mining (modelling)
* Knowledge and skills in statistical modelling: Machine Learning and Data Science
* You are enterprising, ambitious, like to take initiative and you stand firm in your shoes
* You are innovative (we move fast and take big risks)
* You are passionate (we reveal in what we do)
* You are collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together)
* Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and make informed decisions.
* You are communicative, customer-oriented, and proactive.


What do we offer?* A competitive salary: As a trainee, you deserve a good start and a good salary which is yearly reviewed.
* Time for a bonus: Have you really done well? Then we can reward you with a quarterly bonus.
* Let's get healthy: With our wellbeing programs, initiatives and office gym, you are well on your way to a healthy lifestyle.
* Health Insurance & Pension: You can participate in our well-regulated collective health insurance and pension scheme.
* Develop your talents: Work on all your talents with our dedicated and tailored training program.
* Events & Extras: Get discounts on our Samsung Employee Webshop and get ready for epic events throughout the year.

  

How to Apply
Ready to take the next step in your career with Samsung? Apply now by submitting your resume explaining why you’re the perfect fit for our Traineeship kick starting per September 1st.

title: Project Financial Controller
description:
**Job ID:** 248300


**Date posted:** 09/07/2024


**Who you are**  

  

Do you want to be part of Financial Controlling within IKEA NL Retail? We are looking for a Financial Controller for projects!  

  

Your background:
  

* Have a bachelor/master degree in Accounting & Control, Business Administration, Finance or a related field with 1-4 years work experience within Accounting/Controlling/Business Navigation.
* Have knowledge of Dutch GAAP, statutory and regulatory reporting and knowledge to provide support in an auditing process.
* Have knowledge of financial and operational processes (the interdependencies and how to manage them) and tools for accounting and reporting.
* Have knowledge of measuring, processing and communicating financial information in compliance with internal and external regulations and ensuring value for money in reaching business objectives and profitable growth.
* Are experienced with applying new organizational policies and procedures to assess, mitigate, ensure appropriate internal controls and communicate risks to the organization.
* Show good knowledge of project management processes including methods and tools; and how to integrate them in everyday work.
* Show good understanding of data science, analytics, data visualization tools and new technologies to secure a predictive and value-adding finance and accounting function.
* Are motivated to work agile, open to the change and apply learning to perform successfully under new or first time conditions
* Are able to create and implement change initiatives and energized to manage stakeholders to achieve goals in a changing environment
* Are able to communicate confidently and clearly in English & Dutch
* Pre but not a must: knowledge of SAP Ariba Guided Buying

  

**Your responsibilities**  

  

We are looking for a Financial Controller that will be the driver for financial insights in different projects in the country, including construction projects, Digital projects, Transformation projects and Country initiatives. You like to interact with people and want to take the lead. You take initiative and pro-actively engage with project managers. With your insights, you will help project managers, portfolio owners and the management team to keep control over costs which is crucial for steering our business. As a Financial Controller for projects, you will be in the lead for reporting and follow up on the financial performance of these projects working closely together with the business stakeholders, business navigation and accounting.  

  

Next to this, you will also be in the lead for improving our procure to pay process. This involves the onboarding of PO compliance and SAP Ariba in the country. You will work closely with Procurement and the Accounting team to improve our current way of working. You will interact and meet many people in this role and guide them in this process. Furthermore, you will set up and guide the accounting team to enhance a proper follow up process. This also includes creating Power BI dashboards to follow up on KPI’s.  

  

**Our team within Ikea**  

  

The Finance department is the spider in the web when it comes to receiving, processing, and delivering all kinds of financial information. The team consists of 14 direct colleagues. The company is in transformation and continuous improvement and embracement of change is of great importance in this role. You enjoy working in a changing environment, you take initiative and have the ability to adapt your ways of working rapidly.  

  

**Questions and support? Let's connect!**  

  

Whatever we are doing today, we will do a little better tomorrow. If we work together we can care for people and planet. And IKEA will take good care of you too.
  

  

Start as Project Financial and expect the following:  

- The salary indication of this role gross a year including holiday and 13th month is between €56.063,00, and €76.780,- depending on experience.
  

* A 13th month and 8% holiday pay. These will be paid out in December and May as standard, but you can also choose to receive them monthly.
* A collective bonus scheme. This is determined annually and amounts to a maximum of 150% of your gross monthly salary.
* Travel expenses for public transport are reimbursed 100%. Do you live within a radius of 5 to 20 km from the IKEA store? Then you can also opt for a lease bicycle. Are you traveling by car? Then you will receive a travel allowance up to a maximum of 200 euros per month.
* 15% employee discount at all IKEA stores in the Netherlands.
* Various arrangements that suit your personal situation. Think of transition leave and equal (100% paid) birth leave regardless of the composition of your family. You may also exchange the public holidays applicable in the Netherlands with non-Christian holidays.

  

**What else is important**  

  

Due to holiday period the first interviews will be conducted during week 29 & 30. Second interviews will be in week 33.

title: Internship - Commercial Data Analytics
description:
Internship - Commercial Data Analytics


Do you have a data-driven mindset? Do you want to work on commercial business cases powered by analytics?


HEINEKEN is looking for you!



Every day we work with pride on our great products that you have certainly had in your hand at a party, during a work meeting or at home on the couch. HEINEKEN is much more than just beer. What about brands Heineken and Desperados. We actively work to create a pleasant work environment where everyone feels respected and has equal opportunities. Your personality, knowledge and skills are the success of our organization.


The internship



What do we offer?


* The opportunity to develop your analytical skills in a commercial environment
* Formal Power BI trainings and on the job support
* Learn from professionals in using analytical tools
* You will work together with colleagues in the field of Trade Marketing, E-commerce and Digital & Technology


What are you going to do?


* Perform (advanced) analyses on retail sales data and provide your colleagues with insights
* Design and create data visualization by building Power BI dashboards
* Support the data-driven transformation of Heineken Retail


During your internship you will get the opportunity to get to know HEINEKEN as a company, also outside your department. We give you the trust and freedom, so you can work like a real entrepreneur. We like to bring the outside world inside and therefore we embrace new, fresh ideas with enthusiasm. Of course always with the guidance that is right for you.



The department



You will be part of the Data Driven Sales team, which operates within the Retail department of Heineken the Netherlands and consists of six professionals. The team drives the data-driven transformation at Heineken and acts as the insights partner to many stakeholders within the organization. The team works on projects upon requests as well as on more long-term projects that are key to become more data-driven. In our team we use various tools such as Power BI to create accessible dashboarding and clear visualizations, Python for in-dept analyses/visualizations and SQL to retrieve data.



The terms of employment


* Your starting date is flexible, but around 1st of September 2024
* The internship is fulltime (in consultation also 4 days a week possible)
* The duration of the internship is 5 or 6 months (in consultation with your internship supervisor)
* You are registered at an educational institution
* We work from the office in Leiden and remote
* You will receive an internship fee of €500
* If you do not have a student OV product, your commuting expenses will be fully reimbursed


The start of your internship



Together with a diverse group of interns from different departments you will start your internship at HEINEKEN. Together you will be introduced to the organization. Furthermore, you can organize fun activities with your fellow interns.



The unique you!


We believe that everyone has unique talents and are therefore looking for you! The ideal candidate:


* Follows or just finished a WO education in the field of Business Analytics, Economics or Econometrics
* Has some experience with data analysis and/or visualization tools
* Has great communication skills


Interested?  

Great! For more information about this vacancy or about the application process, please contact werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com. You can also apply right now by clicking on the "apply now" button. After that we ask you to fill in some data, write a short motivation for the internship and upload your most recent CV.



The company  

HEINEKEN has been a market leader for more than 150 years. We have a family history and Dutch heritage that we are proud of. This pride is reflected in our entrepreneurship and we take it with us in everything we do and where we go. We are brand builders and the indispensable link between the breweries and the perfect beer in people's homes or on the terrace.


Together we stand for our core values: passion for quality, enjoying life and respect for people and the environment. We always advocate responsible alcohol consumption, feel closely connected to Dutch society and local communities, and constantly strive to improve our impact on the planet.


Embracing and celebrating diversity is at the heart of the purpose of HEINEKEN to "brew the joy of true togetherness to inspire a better world." We believe that people as diverse as our brews - including and not limited to gender, ethnicity, age, sexual orientation, religious beliefs, nationality, social background, disability and thinking style - enrich our lives and strengthen our business. We welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, as we advocate for a culture of belonging that provides fair and equal opportunities for all.



Do you have feedback on this job posting? If so, please email werkenbijheinekennederland@heineken.com

title: Internship Business Intelligence Logistics
description:
Are you a master student with a passion for data visualization, process improvement and logistics? Then apply for our internship within the Logistics BI team of PostNL and support our complete international business!  

  

**Uitdagingen**  


At PostNL, our business unit “Cross Border Solutions” (CBS) makes it easy for people and businesses to communicate and trade across international boundaries. CBS aims to become the most respected service provider by supporting the cross-border e-commerce market through creative and innovative distribution solutions. In this international business unit we have 13 offices worldwide with 1.200 employees, being agile, customer focused and reliable. CBS serves customers over 190 countries. Within CBS, the department called “Business Intelligence & Analytics” (BI&A) provides insights for the entire CBS organization. We aim for the whole of CBS to have the knowledge and tools to be capable to make data driven (fact based) decisions.

  

  

During your Logistics BI internship, you will work together with BI&A and other IT and business colleagues from CBS to automate one of our most labor-intensive processes managed in MS Excel to a master data application. In this project you will analyse the current process, conduct stakeholder interviews and create a proposal to maximize the efficiency. As a next step, you ensure the successful implementation of the accepted proposal by implementing new cross-team ways of working, integrations and conducting trainings where applicable. You are not in it alone! You will get guidance from a team member and have many opportunities to fine-tune your ideas and action plan with colleagues.

  

  

Besides this core project, you will also be invited to participate in the team’s agile rituals and other activities, contribute to the maintenance of existing and building of new reports and can also get your hands dirty in our ongoing dashboard migration and data modelling projects. We also have a number of initiatives running to improve the way we handle unplanned work; have better overview and reporting capabilities about our data and service quality; implement new standards and tools for our engineering framework and experiment with generative AI solutions to make our work smarter. You are, of course, as a Logistics BI intern, invited to play a role in this important transformation journey, and share your own ideas and views!

  

**Je verantwoordelijkheden**  

**Visible work:** You help our (internal) customers with new information and insights, so that they can run the operations and planning efficiently, and make decisions based on the best quality data. Your improvements will allow us to understand performance of our international business even better!  

**Challenge:** You dive into a complex data management process that supports our reporting capabilities. This allows you to really experience what it means to provide insights to the Netherlands' favorite delivery service!  

**Good atmosphere:** You work together with motivated colleagues from 22 nationalities who dare to seize opportunities and help each other move forward.  

**Freedom:** You will work from home and in a flexible workplace in our vibrant, modern office in the historic Stationspostgebouw (next to Holland Spoor station).  

**Development opportunities:** You will be given plenty of opportunities to follow training courses and grow into other positions or departments. Besides working on a central project, you will also have the chance to contribute to various other activities in our end-to-end team of data analysts and engineers, and leave your mark with improvement ideas on all areas of our daily work.  

  

**Wat breng jij mee?**  


With your analytical skills and curiosity, you know how to convert complex data into useful insights. You also have a keen eye and fresh perspective for continuously improving our way of working. With your 'can do' mentality, you connect the different teams in the data flow from source to dashboard to speed up the generation of insights for all the important business decisions we make every day, based on reliable data. You are able to independently tackle various human and organizational issues, from data collection to managing of expectations.  



**In addition, you bring the following with you:**


* You are currently following a relevant university education, such as a Master in IT, Business Administration, Data Science or Statistics;
* Strong working knowledge of MS Office, especially Excel;
* Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. SQL) and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI) is a big plus;
* Good communication skills in English (Dutch is extra);
* You are available for at least 32 hours a week during your internship;
* You are interested in PostNL, the logistics e-commerce industry and our services;
* You can do an internship with us from September 2024 to January/February 2025. The exact start and end dates will be determined in consultation.

  

**Wat bezorgen we jou?**  


An internship full of innovation and work that you literally see in every street in the Netherlands. At PostNL we want to grow into the logistics e-commerce platform of the future. So that we can deliver special moments even smarter, faster and better. Your mentality and our challenge. With us you bring it together.


**You can count on the following benefits:**


* A monthly internship allowance of €500,- based on 40 hours and a travel allowance if applicable;
* A company laptop;
* Office location in The Hague with excellent public transport accessibility (within walking distance of Holland Spoor) and the possibility to work independently of location and time.
* Your colleagues are ready to help you and provide you with the right guidance.

title: Ice Cream Digital Commerce Data & Analytics Analyst
description:
**UNILEVER IS LOOKING FOR AN ICE CREAM DIGITAL COMMERCE DATA & ANALYTICS LEAD**

Location: Weena, Rotterdam with intent to move to Amsterdam in 2025


Full time


Salary: 48-65 K gross per year depending on background and experience.

*A job at Unilever means working with purpose in an inclusive and diverse culture. We think all roles can be made flexible and believe in an approach to getting work done that allows any employee to work anytime, from anywhere.*

**ABOUT ICE CREAM:**

We spark moments of happiness for people and within the communities where we operate. As ice cream makers we are serious about happiness. With warm hearts, we create the coolest products. We are the proof that an unbroken chain of happier people works – for a happy planet and winning smiles. As the largest ice cream company in the world, we have over 100 years of experience in delivering smiles, and we plan to continue this for many more years to come, with our people and planet first.


We have 35 brands, including 3 one billion Euro brands (Magnum, Wall’s, Ben & Jerry’s), in over 60 countries. All driven to spread happiness through indulgent yet responsibly made and marketed products. We have a well-developed strategy to deliver growth and value creation which is clear on our where to play and how to win.

**JOB PURPOSE**


Unilever is the place where you can bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. If you are a data whiz with a business brain and a desire to be at the forefront of change in Qcom, then this is the role for you.

**WHAT WILL YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES BE**

Strengthen the future-focused capabilities by:

* Define and execute the data product strategy and roadmap with business stakeholders and development teams.
* Lead the development, maintenance and optimization of scalable data visualization tools and tech solutions.
* Lead the expansion of product analytics: from opportunity sizing to post-launch impact.
* Build strong relationships with stakeholders across tech, development, and business teams.
* Collaborate with external partners on data roadmaps and establish data maturity frameworks.
* Provide data-driven support to internal stakeholders for informed decision-making.
* Guide business key stakeholders on leveraging data to achieve goals.

 **WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:**

* Minimum 4+ years of experience of experience delivering actionable insights in a data-driven environment. Prior experience in a global tech / food / FMCG company is a plus.
* Analytical skills: Extensive experience with complex modeling and conducting quantitative analysis.
* Digital Commerce knowledge (a plus): Understanding of the digital commerce space and the biggest food delivery partners.
* Communication skills: Strong communication and presentation skills to present analysis


clearly and concisely to executives and management.

* Relationship building: Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders and influence  

them with concrete recommendations across all levels (local, central, and external teams).
* Problem-solving: A resourceful problem-solver with a proactive approach who can drive  

alignment even in ambiguous situations.
* Project Plan: experience creating and following project plans. Prior experience as a project  

lead is a plus.
* Technical skills: Proficiency in MS Excel, PowerPoint, and Power BI. Understanding of Azure,  

Databricks is a plus.
* Programming skills (a plus): Skilled in SQL, Python, R, or similar programming languages.
* English fluency: Fluent in written and spoken English.

**SKILLS**

* Data expertise & management
* Business engagement
* Information delivery
* Demand & delivery
* Product management
* Stakeholder management
* Effective communication

**WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?**

  

Unilever is the place where you can be yourself and bring your purpose to life with the work that you do – creating a better business and a better world. We offer an exciting & dynamic work environment where you can make things happen. Furthermore, we offer some great reward and benefits!

* Attractive total remuneration package; excellent company pension, bonus, share scheme.
* Flexible cross-disciplinary career opportunities and a wealth of training opportunities & wellbeing resources whenever and wherever.
* Plenty of company-paid holidays to further ensure your work-life balance is maintained.
* We encourage an inclusive culture, which comes to life with interchangeable public holidays, paid paternity leave of 6 weeks and our transgender policy.
* We are working under the Hybrid Working principles. You will be expected to  

to be in the office for 3-4 days per week (Amsterdam in 2025). For the time you work from home, we will ensure you are well equipped.
* Informal culture and being the first one trying our new products.
* My Fitness Plan (reduction on your Fitness Subscription).
* Home work allowance
* Company laptop and mobile phone
* Green Mobility Policy.

 **EXCITED?**


Join Unilever and our team! To apply, you must do so online. Please do not forget to upload your CV and a motivation letter. Your application will be reviewed against our requirements and we will be in touch shortly after the closing date to provide you with an update on the status of your application.


Looking forward to meeting you!


Please note this is a Direct Search led by Unilever. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs.


Unilever embraces diversity and encourages applicants from all walks of life! This means giving full and fair consideration to all applicants and continuing development of all employees regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, race, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, marriage and civil partnership, and pregnancy and maternity.

*By highlighting the gender diversity at the workplace, Unilever encourages women equally men to apply. If you look for a job after a long career break or after any type of leave, do not hesitate to apply.*

*Please save a copy of this vacancy for personal use as it will disappear from the website after closing of the role.*

title: FULL-TIME FRONTEND DEVELOPER
description:
AMSTERDAM, THE NETHERLANDS
**JOIN OUR TEAM**
-----------------



BrainCreators is an innovative technology firm that specializes in Software as a Service (SaaS) products. Our flagship software products, INSPECH Digital Road Inspection and SEAGULL Surveillance, are designed to solve real-world problems and revolutionize industries globally. Our SaaS products are centered around visual inspection tasks, utilizing the latest and most advanced ML technology.

  

As a frontend developer, you’ll be part of the **IN****SPECH** product team. You'll work with talented colleagues who have a sharp focus on scalable products for a worldwide market.


**Interests:**
--------------


+ You must have a product-oriented mindset, care deeply about the product, and demonstrate keen attention to detail in your work.
+ An interest in the application of ML technologies
+ A sense of humor and a desire to interact with people
+ Stay up-to-date with the latest trends, tools, and technologies
+ An attitude of taking responsibility and ownership
**Core responsibilities:**
--------------------------

  

* Design and build highly usable user interfaces, using Typescript and React
* Optimize frontend performance to deliver fast and efficient applications
* Strong debugging skills to identify and resolve issues in existing codebases
* Stay up-to-date with the latest frontend trends, tools, and technologies and proactively propose improvements to the existing codebase
**Team responsibilities:**
--------------------------

  

* Collaborate with the product manager and design team to understand requirements and create responsive, intuitive, and visually appealing user interfaces (knowledge of UX/UI design principles is a bonus)
* Collaborate with backend developers to integrate frontend components with server-side logic.
* Collaborate with ML engineers to create visual representations for innovative features.
* Contribute to the team spirit with a constructive attitude by giving and receiving feedback
* Contribute to code reviews and provide constructive feedback to your peers
* Enhance the team's collective knowledge and become a highly valued participant in frontend chapter meetings, write articles for our internal blog platform
* Join the effort to contribute to the shared components' library across teams
**Qualifications:**
-------------------

  

* A relevant completed higher education or equivalent working experience
* Proven experience of at least **4 years**as Frontend Developer or in a similar position
* Develop highly composable, readable, testable, and efficient code
* Fluency in standard frontend technologies such as proficiency in React, TypeScript, (S)CSS and HTML
* Have a good understanding of the git version control systems and package managers such as npm and yarn
* Have an understanding of the fundamentals of the HTTP protocol
* Have experience with React Testing Library and Jest to proficiently write tests, ensuring the quality and stability of your codebase
* Have an experience with at least one of UI components libraries (Material UI, Ant Design, Bootstrap, Chakra UI) or eager to learn
* Have an experience or Interested in learning data visualization frameworks (e.g., deck.gl)
* A plus is familiarity with frontend build tools and preprocessors (e.g., Webpack, Babel). Experience with scrum and agile development

Having experience with ergonomics and UX design is welcomed too  
* 
**What we offer:**
------------------

  

* An open culture with many opportunities to work with cutting-edge technology
* Inspiring colleagues from all over the world
* A cutting-edge office environment with LED walls, gym, sauna, nightclub, and a fantastic view of the Amsterdam Houthavens
* A delightful opportunity to enjoy drinks together after work
* A budget for team outgoings
* Room for personal growth and initiative
* Competitive salary package, participation in the pension plan, and 25 days of paid leave
* All the benefits of a scale-up company and a future option to participate in our success
**Ready to apply?**
-------------------


Upload your CV and cover letter here and we'll be in touch with you shortly.
ABOUT US
**OUR MISSION AND VISION**
--------------------------


**We are here** to automate highly skilled repetitive inspection work and present the results as actionable insights in cutting edge user experiences to empower the industries that make the most positive impact on our common future and contribute in closing the skills gap.  

  

We allow expert human inspectors to clone their knowledge in a digital counterpart and share the resulting digital inspector with others as a software service.
**We help create a future** where human beings focus on drawing conclusions from consistent inspection results and turn their interpretation into concrete action to eliminate waste, reduce cost and accelerate innovation.  

  

In the future the application of technologies like deep learning and AI will allow us to spend less time on repetitive tasks and shift our attention to making changes that impact the sustainability of our environment and natural resources.
### **GROW PERSONALLY AND PROFESSIONALLY**


Join **BRAINCREATORS** and be part of creating products that shape the future of work.

title: Internship: Process Mining IGT-Devices
description:
Job Title
Internship: Process Mining IGT-Devices
Job Description
Start date: Q3 2024
Duration: 5-6 months
Type: Non-Thesis
Weekly presence: 40 hours per week
You will have an opportunity to learn, play a key part in, and drive supply chain analytics and process mining initiative to structurally improve our End-to-End flows and performance. Working closely with data and process specialists and various stakeholders to gain actionable insights and stimulate knowledge sharing and lessons learned.
Your role:* Process Mapping and Visualization: Create visual representations of the contracting and quoting processes, including data flows and decision points.
* Data Integration and Connectivity: Establish connections between the IT-tools to support these processes, ensuring a unified view of customer interactions and equipment offering processes.
* Process Mining Analysis: Apply process mining techniques to analyze the process flow, identify deviations, and measure key performance indicators.
* Recommendations and Conclusion: Propose recommendations for process optimization by identifying and elimination of waste and reducing cycle time of the entire E2E process. This may include automation opportunities and improved data connectivity between IT-tools, based on the findings from the analysis.
* Share your knowledge and insights to educate the organization, ensuring professional communication and timely updates.


You're the right fit if:* Studying towards your Bachelor or Master University degree study in: Business Administration, Business Management, Industrial Engineering.
* Good knowledge of English language both verbally and written
* Self-starter, not afraid to look for information and reach out to new people.
* Analytical thinker, with a detail and process-oriented mindset
* Ability to digest and organize large amounts of data.
* Ideally experience with power point and excel skills and knowledge in data analytics/management and process mining.


IMPORTANT:
Part of our selection procedure is a HireVue Assessment. We are not able to correspond the outcome of this HireVue Assessment but will use this as an extra selection criterion.
Our intern remuneration package:* Monthly full-time allowance between €500 - €700 gross, depending on educational level and if you would need to relocate to The Netherlands. If you perform a part-time internship, you will receive an allowance pro-rata.
* Housing compensation, in case of relocating to the vicinity of the office, €300,- net if location is in the vicinity of Amsterdam, €255,- net for all other Philips locations. You need to provide a rental contract of the landlord, and your normal home-work travel distance need to be more than 50 km or travel time (one way trip) need to be more than 1.5 hours.
* Travel compensation, if you are not eligible for a free public transport card; you will receive max. €192,- net
* Paid holidays per internship term.
* The opportunity to buy Philips products at our Philips shop


Notes
Required documents for us to continue with your application:* Resume


Please note that to be considered for an internship, you need to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation of which may be requested at any time. Students from outside the EU need to fill in a NUFFIC agreement, which needs to be signed by the student and the university.
Please note that the contents of our regular internship assignments are not suitable for professionals (and/or MBA students) with professional work experience.
#Li-EU
